integer.name: maxActive
integer.caption: Max active
integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can be borrowed from the pool at one time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be active at one time. When maxActive is exceeded, the pool is said to be exhausted.

integer.name: maxIdle
integer.caption: Max idle
integer.description: Controls the maximum number of connections that can sit idle in the pool at any time. When set to a negative value, there is no limit to the number of connections that may be idle at one time.

enum.name: initialisationPolicy
enum.caption: Initialisation policy
enum.description: Determines how connections in a pool should be initialized. The possible values are: INITIALISE_NONE (will not load any connection into the pool on startup), INITIALISE_ONE (will load one initial connection into the pool on startup), or INITIALISE_ALL (will load all connections in the pool on startup)

enum.name: exhaustedAction
enum.caption: Exhausted action
enum.description: Specifies the behavior of the connection pool when the pool is exhausted. Possible values are: "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_FAIL", which will throw a NoSuchElementException, "WHEN_EXHAUSTED_WAIT", which will block by invoking Object.wait(long) until a new or idle object is available, or WHEN_EXHAUSTED_GROW, which will create a new connection and return it, essentially making maxActive meaningless. If a positive maxWait value is supplied, it will block for at most that many milliseconds, after which a NoSuchElementException will be thrown. If maxThreadWait is a negative value, it will block indefinitely.

integer.name: maxWait
integer.caption: Max wait
integer.description: When exhausted action is Wait (or block) this is the amount of time in milliseconds that the pool will wait before failing. Setting a negative value will block indefinitely until an idle instance becomes available.

integer.name: minEvictionMillis
integer.caption: Min eviction (ms)
integer.description: Determines the minimum amount of time a connection may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction. When non-positive, no connections will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

integer.name: evictionCheckIntervalMillis
integer.caption: Eviction check interval (ms)
integer.description: Specifies the number of milliseconds between runs of the connection evictor. When non-positive, no connection evictor is executed.

label.name: connectionLabel
label.caption: Define how mule should attempt to handle a connection failure

radioBoolean.name: noReconnection
radioBoolean.caption: Do not use a Reconnection strategy

radioBoolean.name: standardReconnection
radioBoolean.caption: Standard Reconnection
radioBoolean.description: A reconnection strategy that allows the user to configure how many times a reconnection should be attempted and how long to wait between attempts.

integer.name: reconnectionAttemps
integer.caption: Reconnection Attempts
integer.description: How many reconnection attempts to make

boolean.name: reconnectForever
boolean.caption: Reconnect Forever
boolean.description: A reconnection strategy that retries an infinite number of times at the specified frequency.

classname.name: class
classname.caption: Class
classname.description: A class that implements the RetryPolicyTemplate interface.

name.name: name
name.caption: Name
name.description: Give a name to this configuration so it can be later referenced by config-ref.

string.name: username
string.caption: Username
string.description: The authorization username.

string.name: serviceUri
string.caption: Service Uri
string.description: The URI of the target OData Service.

string.name: consumerFactory-ref
string.caption: Consumer Factory Reference
string.description:
An instance of to intanciate the . Normally you don't need to set this unless you require some custom initialization of the consumer or if you are doing test cases.
If this property is not specified, then an instance of is used.

enum.name: consumerVersion
enum.caption: Consumer Version
enum.description: The protocol version to be used when consuming external services.

enum.name: formatType
enum.caption: Format Type
enum.description: The format of the payload to be used during communication. Valid values are JSON and ATOM.

enum.name: namingFormat
enum.caption: Naming Format
enum.description:
The namig policy to be used when mapping pojo's attributes to OData entities. Depending on the OData service you're consuming, you might find that attributes usually follows a lower camel case format (e.g.: theAttribute) or an upper camel case format (e.g.: TheAttribute).
The naming format assumes that your pojo's properties follow the lower camel case format (just as the java coding standard dictates) and translates to the format that the OData service is expecting.
Valid values are: LOWER_CAMEL_CASE and UPPER_CAMEL_CASE.

globalRef.name: config-ref
globalRef.caption: Connector Configuration
globalRef.description: Specify which configuration to use for this invocation.

cloud-connector.caption: OData
cloud-connector.description:
Connector for consuming OData feeds by performing read, create, update and delete operations. Bath operations are also supported.
This version of the connector does not use any kind of authentication.

element-controller-list.caption: Processors
element-controller-list.description: Nested processors where each individual operation is to be performed.

string.name: username
string.caption: Username
string.description: The authorization username.

string.name: serviceUri
string.caption: Service Uri
string.description: The URI of the target OData Service.

string.name: entity-ref
string.caption: Entity Reference
string.description: An object representing the entity.

string.name: entitySetName
string.caption: Entity Set Name
string.description: The name of the set. If not specified then it's inferred by adding the suffix 'Set' to the objects simple class name.

string.name: username
string.caption: Username
string.description: The authorization username.

string.name: serviceUri
string.caption: Service Uri
string.description: The URI of the target OData Service.

string.name: entity-ref
string.caption: Entity Reference
string.description: An object representing the entity.

string.name: entitySetName
string.caption: Entity Set Name
string.description: The name of the set. If not specified then it's inferred by adding the suffix 'Set' to the objects simple class name.

string.name: keyAttribute
string.caption: Key Attribute
string.description: The name of the pojo's attribute that holds the entity's key. The attribute cannot hold a null value.

string.name: username
string.caption: Username
string.description: The authorization username.

string.name: serviceUri
string.caption: Service Uri
string.description: The URI of the target OData Service.

string.name: username
string.caption: Username
string.description: The authorization username.

string.name: serviceUri
string.caption: Service Uri
string.description: The URI of the target OData Service.

string.name: entitySetName
string.caption: Entity Set Name
string.description: The name of the set to be read.

string.name: expand
string.caption: Expand
string.description: Sets the expand expressions.

string.name: filter
string.caption: Filter
string.description: An OData filtering expression. If not provided, no filtering occurs (see http://www.odata.org/developers/protocols/uri-conventions#FilterSystemQueryOption).

string.name: orderBy
string.caption: Order By
string.description: The ordering expression. If not provided, no ordering occurs (see http://www.odata.org/developers/protocols/uri-conventions#OrderBySystemQueryOption(.

string.name: returnClass
string.caption: Return Class
string.description: The canonical class name for the pojo instances to be returned. If none especified then generic OEntity class will be returned. OEntity is a pojo which represents the set's metadata and allows for browsing.

integer.name: skip
integer.caption: Skip
integer.description: Number of items to skip, usefull for pagination. If not provided, no records are skept (see http://www.odata.org/developers/protocols/uri-conventions#SkipSystemQueryOption).

string.name: select
string.caption: Select
string.description: The selection clauses. If not specified, all fields are returned (see http://www.odata.org/developers/protocols/uri-conventions#SelectSystemQueryOption).

string.name: username

string.description: The authorization username.

string.description: The URI of the target OData Service.

string.description: An object representing the entity.

string.name: entitySetName
string.caption: Entity Set Name
string.description: The name of the set. If not specified then it's inferred by adding the suffix 'Set' to the objects simple class name.

string.name: keyAttribute
string.caption: Key Attribute
string.description: The name of the pojo's attribute that holds the entity's key. The attribute cannot hold a null value.
